intro: Crotalaria stipularia var. balansae, commonly known as the narrow-leaf crotalaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its small, yellow,蝶形花 (butterfly-shaped) flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed soils or along roadsides. It has a short flowering period, usually in the dry season, and produces pod-like fruits containing several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
